comment._content: I thought I was familiar with this sequence, but I don't recall seeing a crowd of onlookers in the background before. Now we just need beachcomberaustralia to give us the relevant newspaper article ...

comment._content: What I fond intriguing is that the Mayor, was a C Moore!!!! 2nd para, midway through (1867-1968). I wonder if there is any relation to the current Mayor, C Moore...
comment.authorname: A u s s i e P o m m

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/berniep] That's fun! I wonder if the Seymour Centre was named for them too?! This was Charles Moore (1820-1895) who did a lot of good works for Sydney, particularly Moore Park, and Moore Street (Martin Place).

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I think it is Moore's name on the obelisk at the end of Bathurst Street.   In this photo,  there is a large crowd in the background - they must be expecting something to happen !
